website_summaries.verdict: Works well for those who love all things rustic, although you may have to work on it a bit to get it stable.
pros: Features a traditional cast iron design, and a nice rustic look
Very durable, and works well to keep tea hot
Easy to light, even with a pot on it
cons: Some buyers found that the legs do not sit even, which results in a wobble effect
If you get one of these, try switching out the position of the legs

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I use this EVERY day. Best purchase I’ve made in a long time. I was worried it would not keep the tea hot because the base is open, but it works perfectly, and it’s beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly, bad design, lack of care from company
customer_reviews.text: It is horribly wobbly, 2 of the legs aren't matching with the rest so no matter what you're going to have to worry about your tea pot tipping. Very dissatisfied. Very dangerous to have a full pot of hot tea with a live candle underneath and it wobbles as bad as it does. See picture. I am returning and highly suggest that until the company quality checks or redesigns to not purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: While the product is beautiful, I give it one star because of safety concerns. Like many reviews already stated, the top is warped, the legs do not meet the tabletop evenly, and the screws do not all lie flat against the top, especially concerning since I bought it to use with a glass teapot. After reading the reviews, I decided to purchase despite the feedback because those were written quite a while ago and I had hoped that the problem was fixed. Sadly not, I'll be returning, silly me!
customer_reviews.author: Trix678

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and rustic looking!
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty pot warmers and I like that because I don’t believe they’ll get knocked over. I bought three of these as gifts because I use mine as a coffee mug warmer and I’ve got many compliments on its looks and that it keeps my large mugs of coffee at a good drinking temperature. I did receive one with a tiny bump on one of the feet but it was easily filed down.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This warmer is sturdy and big and looks very rustic and pretty, but it does not keep anything warm. I think it's probably because of the airy design that the heat of the candle dissipates and cannot keep the pot warm. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DanceswithNaduah

customer_reviews.title: the perfect way to warm my Japanese tea pot gently without ...
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is much sturdier than it looks in the picture, the perfect way to warm my Japanese tea pot gently without over-boiling the green tea. It's pretty enough to leave out even when not in use. I'd only recommend using a natural non-oily wrought or cast iron cleaning product on it, though, since it's meant to prepare food and powered by a candle. Basic care will keep it from rusting and make it last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Grooms

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY-and BEAUTIFUL
customer_reviews.text: THE ONE I RECEIVED IS VERY STURDY, so maybe that got fixed. I think it is EXCELLENT, if you like Cast iron (and I do). Not only it it strong and practical, it is also a beautiful object to display. - There is also another similar one, that I also purchased , just a different size, but also sturdy and beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Coffee, Tea, Soups-Power Outages
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Heavy Duty and durable my intention is to have a way to warm/hot caffeinated beverages and soups when I lose power during a Polar Vortex. (I AINT going outside during Polar Votex)

customer_reviews.title: Bought it used, but cast iron is durable as ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used, but cast iron is durable as hell, so unless you really want to destroy this thing, it's indestructible. Be mindful of the screws holding things in place - since iron doesn't flex, your screws will be the weakest point and you may wish to tighten them occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a cast iron teapot.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift to go with a cast iron teapot purchased a number of years ago. It looks great with the teapot and works well to keep the tea warm and drinkable for hours. This is a heavy weight warmer and could be used with a very heavy teapot. The only issue I had at all with is was that one of the feet had a slightly rough spot. I applied a cushioned pad to each of the feet and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: So it wobbles a little.  Big deal.
customer_reviews.text: The wobble is part of its charm, and it is, according to many visitors to my house, very charming. (Not one person has said 'What terrible craftsmanship!') What this thing does is provide a very welcome amenity: a hot pot of tea in the depths of winter. Slow down, don't worry about first world problems like are you getting screwed because of the wobble, and sip a soothing hot cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy K.
